Context:
The George Brown College student portal offers mental health counselling services to registered students. The team is composed of masters-level clinicians who are either registered psychotherapists (RP) or registered social workers (RSW). Students can learn more about therapeutic and psychoeducational groups, workshops, webinars, in-class presentations, and how to sign up for these services on the Counselling and Confidentiality page.

The college strives for a trauma-informed, anti-oppressive, student-centered approach and encourages feedback. Students outside of Ontario or Canada can visit the Guide for Students Outside of Ontario for counselling options. For academic questions, contact the respective academic department or program coordinator. In case of crisis, contact appropriate Emergency Services. The college operates under the policies of the Office of Anti-Racism, Equity, and Human Rights Services.

Contact Information:
- Phone: 416-415-2000
- TTY: 1-877-515-5559
- Email: ask.george@georgebrown.ca
- Social Media Hub: Visit the site for more information.

The website content is subject to change without notice, and students are responsible for verifying college fee requirements.

Email addresses: ask.george@georgebrown.ca
